original_title: Sri Lanka President opens electric vehicle assembly plant
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka President Ranil Wickremesinghe has opened an electric vehicle plant in Minneriya, in the agricultural heartland of the country which will assemble tractors, three and two wheelers.
Volta Auto Tec Engineering Private Limited has a partnership with an Indian company, a statement from the President’s media office said.
“The government is looking into ways of supporting this initiative,” President Wickremesinghe was quoted as saying at the opening of the assembly plant with founder Jagath Makavita.
“We should appreciate this step taken to create a green economy. All should work to shift the country’s economy to a green economy by implementing such projects.
“Now, the countries of the world are moving towards a green economy. As Sri Lanka, we should also embark on that journey.”
Particulate emissions from vehicles are a key source of air pollution in urban centres and electric vehicles can reduce it.
“Sri Lanka has the potential to achieve many advantages by moving towards a green economy in the next five years,” Wickremesinghe said.
“In this regard, the country needs such investors and businessmen who stand up on their own. Therefore, I congratulate Mr. Jagath Makavita on this initiative.”
